tidbits.title: French Territory in North America
tidbits.description: Saint Pierre and Miquelon is a self-governing territorial overseas collectivity of France, making it the only remaining part of New France in North America.

tidbits.title: Prohibition-Era Legacy
tidbits.description: During the Prohibition era, these islands became a significant hub for alcohol smuggling into the United States, contributing to their intriguing historical narrative.

tidbits.title: Rich Maritime Culture
tidbits.description: The islands have a rich maritime heritage with fishing as a primary industry, and the local culture reflects this history, offering unique experiences for visitors.
